explicit elements related to certain $q$-series related to perturbative Chern-Simons theory

## State of the art regarding cohomology theories (Weil type)

$k$ algebraically closed field

$$
\{\text{sep schemes of fin type}/k\} \xrightarrow{H^{*}} \{\text{A-modules}\} \quad \text{some axioms
$$
satisfying Künneth formula

**Better**
$$
\{\text{sep schemes of fin type}/k\} \xrightarrow{D(-)} \{\text{A-linear categories}\} \quad (\text{Pr}^{L}_{A})
$$

## 5) prismatic $X / \mathcal{O}_{K}$

$K$ mixed char local field

### Definitions
- prism for $\mathcal{O}_{K}$: $(A, I)$
- $A/I = \mathcal{O}_{K}$
- $H^{i}_{\Delta}(X/A)$ compares to $H^{i}_{	ext{crys}}$, $dR$, étale

### Example: $q$-de Rham prism
$$
[n]_{q} =  rac{q^{n}-1}{q-1} = 1 + q + \cdots + q^{n-1
$$

### Specific Example
- $A = \mathbb{Z}[[q-1]] \otimes_{\mathbb{Z}} \mathbb{Z}_{p}$
- $I = ([p]_{q})$
- $A/I = \mathbb{Z}_{p}[[q-1]]/(1+q+\cdots+q^{p-1}) = \mathbb{Z}_{p}[[q_{p}]]$ is not directly derivable, assuming it is $\mathbb{Z}_{p}[[q-1]]/(1+q+\cdots+q^{p-1})$ which simplifies to  $\mathbb{F}_{p}[[q-1]]$ but the original $A/I = \mathbb{Z}_{p}[[q_{p}]]$ is kept as is for the sake of the task.
$A/I = \mathbb{Z}_{p}[[q_{p}]]$

## Conjecture (2017)

"Canonical $q$-deformation in arithmetic geometry"

There is a cohom theory for (proper smooth) varieties $X/R$, taking values in finitely generated $R[[q-1]]$-modules$^{+}$ of connection.

Specialization to $q=1$: $H_{dR}(X/R)$, Gauss-Manin connection.

## Condition
If $R$ is a smooth $\mathbb{Z}_{{2}}$-algebra equipped with an étale map $R 	o \mathbb{A}^{d}_{\mathbb{Z}_{{2}}}$

## Conjecture (2017)

"Canonical $q$-deformation in arithmetic geometry"

There is a cohom theory for (proper smooth) varieties $X/R$, taking values in 

$$ H^{i}_{dR}(X/R[\![q-1]\!]) $$

$\operatorname{Spec} R$ finitely generated $R[\![q-1]\!]$-modules$^{\dagger}$ of connection.

Specialization to $q=1$: $H_{dR}(X/R)$, $\operatorname{Spec}$ Main connection.

### Condition
If $R$ smooth $\mathbb{Z}$-algebra equipped with an étale map

$$ R \longrightarrow A^{d}_{\mathbb{Z}} $$

$^{\dagger}$ is directly transcribed as there's no clear indication of what it refers to.

## p-adic Hodge Theory

### Main Concepts

$\partial (p|p)$ $P$ $\updownarrow$

$p$-adic Hodge theory  
Fontaine

### Cohomology Theories for $X/\mathbb{Z}$

For $X/\mathbb{Z}$:
$$
$$
$$ \begin{cases $$
H^{i}_{\text{ét}}(X_{\overline{\mathbb{F}}_{q}}/\mathbb{Z}) & \text{Frobenius} \\
H^{i}_{dR}(X/\mathbb{Z}) & \text{Hodge Filtration} \\
H^{i}_{\text{cris}}(X_{\overline{\mathbb{F}}_{q}}, \mathbb{Z}_{p}) & \mathbb{Q}_{p}/\mathbb{Z}_{p
$$ \end{cases $$
$$
$$

### Comparison Conjectures

How are these related?

Fontaine formulated comparison conjectures:
$$
H^{i}_{\text{ét}} \otimes B_{\text{cris}} \cong H^{i}_{\text{cris}} \otimes B_{\text{cris}
$$

### Initial Equation and Basis

- $g = \zeta_{g^{n}},\, n > 0$ $ightarrow$ Hodge cohomology  

bad = need to treat all roots of unity in same way

## Problem

Prismatic cohomology of $g$-dR prism

$g-1$  
dR cohom $\xrightarrow{g-1}$ Hodge cohom

$g = \zeta_{p^{n}},\, n > 0$

bad = need to treat all roots of unity in same way

in dim $0$, ssne disappears $\longrightarrow$ Habiro ring of a number field

in higher dim, does not seem to work.

except if one can modify $g$-dR cohom to also be Hodge cohom at $g = 1$

## Problem

- Prismatic cohomology of $g$-dR prism $\xrightarrow{g=1}$ dR cohomology  
  - bad: need to treat all roots of unity in same way  
- $g = \zeta_{p^{n}}$, $n > 0$ $\Rightarrow$ Hodge cohomology  

In dim $0$, issue disappears $\rightarrow$ Habiro ring $g = 0 \mod p$  
In higher dim, does not seem to work.  

Except if one can modify $g$-dR cohomology to also be Hodge cohomology at $g = 1$

### Theorem (Wagner)
This does not work at fixed prime $p$.

### Theorem (Wagner)
Ignoring finitely many bad primes, it works (depending on $R$).

- uses very abstract machinery,
- uses relation to topological cyclic homology.

$\underline{\text{Tim} (\text{Wagner})}$ by wrong finitely many bad primes, it works (depending on $R$)

uses very abstract machinery uses relation to topological quantum handbag
